subject: Critical Thinking
title: In-Group Bias: Us vs. Them
description: One-minute skill: In-Group Bias: Us vs. Them.

hook.text: Henri Tajfel assigned people to groups by coin flip.

buildup.text: In-group bias: we favor members of our own group â€” even when the group is arbitrary and meaningless.

discovery.text: This bias operates on every axis: nationality, religion, sports teams, even which brand of phone you use.

twist.text: In-group bias doesn't require hating the out-group. It just requires giving your group the benefit of the doubt.

climax.text: It's the foundation of tribalism, nationalism, and partisan politics â€” and it activates in milliseconds.

punchline.text: You don't need a reason to favor your group. You do it by default.

quiz.question: What did Tajfel's experiments show about group identity?
options: Group favoritism requires a meaningful reason
People favor their group even when it's randomly assigned
